text:
February 5, 1969 2:30 p.m.

GBS DECLINES COMMENT ON FCC ADVERTISING PROPOSAL
BS DECLINES COMMENT ON FCC ADVERTISING PROPOSAL

New York (DJ) -- Columbia Broadcasting System
said it has "no immediate comment on the report that the

FCC has voted to ban cigarette advertising on radio and television, "

"We will have no comment until we have seen the FCC

release", the company said.

OT68Z0S00T

February fin, 1969 deuce: thirty p. m. GBS DECLINES COMMENT ON FCC ADVERTISING PROPOSAL BS DECLINES COMMENT ON FCC ADVERTISING PROPOSAL New York (DJ) - - Columbia Broadcasting System said it has " no immediate remark on the report that the FCC has voted to ban cigarette advertising on radio and telecasting, " " We will have no comment until we have seen the FCC release ", the company said. OT68Z0S00T
summary: Columbia Broadcasting System has "no immediate comment" on the report that the FCC has voted to ban cigarette advertising on radio and television. The company said it will have no comment until it has seen the proposed ban on cigarette ads on television and radio. Columbia Broadcasting system: "We will not comment on this matter until we have seen" the proposal.
